HTLV-1 infection causes an adult T cell leukemia in humans .
The viral encoded protein <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , is thought to play an important role in oncogenesis .

Our previous data obtained from a <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transgenic mouse model revealed that <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transforms mouse fibroblasts but not thymocytes , despite comparable levels of <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in both tissues .

Constitutive tyrosine phosphorylation of a 130-kD protein ( s ) was observed in the <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transformed fibroblast B line and in HTLV-1 transformed human lymphoid lines , but not in thymocytes from Thy-tax transgenic mice .

Phosphotyrosine immunoprecipitation followed by Western blot analysis with a set of Jak kinase specific antibodies , identified p130 as <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transformed mouse fibroblastic cell line and <extra_id_0> Jak3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in HTLV-1 transformed human T cell lines .

text: Tyrosine phosphorylation of this protein could also be induced in Balb / c3T3 cells using a supernatant from the B line , which was associated with induction of cell proliferation .
Both phosphorylation and proliferation were inhibited by <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> neutralizing antibodies .
Constitutive phosphorylation of Jak kinases may facilitate tumor growth in both HTLV-1 infected human T cells and the transgenic mouse model .
